options.value: Senior Backend Engineer – Systems Reliability & Security
Senior Full Stack Engineer – From Idea to Production

items.text: Senior engineer taking products from vague idea to reliable production systems.
Built/operated backends handling real money and high concurrency; focuses on predictability over time.
Experience safeguarding ~$4M client assets on-chain with zero security incidents.
Cost-focused: simplified/right-sized AWS to cut spend ~60% without hurting performance.
Scaled real-time backend throughput ~10× for thousands of concurrent users.
Works well with founders, product, auditors, and non-technical stakeholders; documents systems for reuse.
Emphasis on clean UX layered on top of robust, secure, cost-efficient backends.
Programming since 2011.
Professional production work since Oct 2018 (7+ years).
Shipped multiple MVPs from idea → production as founding engineer/technical founder.
Built full stack web applications (frontend + backend + infra) used by real users in production.
Improved reliability in a high-traffic SaaS from ~65% → 92%.
Scaled throughput ~10× to handle real growth / thousands of concurrent users in low-latency API.
Cut cloud infrastructure costs by ~60% by simplifying/right-sizing AWS backend architecture.
Safeguarded ~$4M in client funds on-chain over ~3 years with zero security incidents + strong audit outcomes.
Reduced gas fees by ~99% for a critical on-chain operation via workflow redesign.
Built fraud detection pipeline flagging ~10% of user activity as likely fraudulent.
Saved ~3 hours/day via SecOps automation (security operations).
Achieved 9/10 external security audit score (worked with auditors).
Saved ~$50K+ in outsourcing/agency spend by taking backend/infra/security in-house.
Prevented spending $10k to build unnecessary product; instead built a demo ready for investor pitch in 10 days.
Backend & Systems Reliability
Scalability & Performance
Cost Optimization
Security / SecDevOps
End-to-End Ownership
MVP Delivery & Product Iteration
Clean UX over robust backends

stack_scope.text: Built and hardened a React frontend + Python backend on Google Cloud for a pre-beta launch phase.

bullets.text_long: Implemented input validation and request guardrails (server-side validation + API rate limiting) to reduce obvious abuse and failure modes during early user onboarding.
bullets.text_short: Added server-side validation + rate limiting to reduce abuse during onboarding.

bullets.text_long: Added client-side caching to cut redundant API calls, improving perceived speed and reducing backend load/cost.
bullets.text_short: Added client-side caching to reduce redundant calls and backend load.

bullets.text_long: Replaced generic errors with application-level notifications and actionable messages to reduce user confusion during failures and improve recovery paths.
bullets.text_short: Improved failure UX with actionable errors and recovery messaging.

bullets.text_long: Added baseline observability (error tracking + metrics/logging and alerts) to detect issues before users reported them.
bullets.text_short: Added error tracking + metrics/logging + alerts for early detection.

bullets.text_long: Introduced unit testing and continuous deployment to reduce deployment mistakes and standardize releases.
bullets.text_short: Introduced unit tests + continuous deployment to reduce deployment mistakes.

bullets.text_long: Brought in pre-beta to review system readiness and de-risk upcoming user growth and first campaign launch; focused on failure modes like bot/abuse, noisy deploys, silent errors and degraded UX.
bullets.text_short: Pre-beta readiness + failure-mode hardening for onboarding and first launch.

bullets.text_long: Supported beta launch with no major technical incidents reported during initial rollout.
bullets.text_short: Supported beta launch with no major incidents reported.

bullets.text_long: Reviewed existing architecture and delivery pipeline to assess scalability, security, and operational risks ahead of first user onboarding.
bullets.text_short: Reviewed architecture + delivery pipeline for onboarding readiness risks.

bullets.text_long: Enhanced CI/CD workflows, reducing deployment errors (claimed ~50% previously → now “material reduction”) and accelerating release cycles by ~25%; deployment errors became rare / no longer a routine issue.
bullets.text_short: Improved CI/CD; reduced deployment errors and sped up releases (~25%).

evidence.method: observed cadence + deploy error frequency (no baseline dashboard)

bullets.text_long: Architected a scalable, multi-stage development environment (dev / staging / prod) to support safer iteration and controlled launches.
bullets.text_short: Set up dev/staging/prod environments for safer launches.

bullets.text_long: Implemented caching strategies that reduced API response times by ~40% under expected load.
bullets.text_short: Implemented caching; reduced API response times ~40% (expected load).

bullets.text_long: Provided hands-on guidance across DevOps, refactoring, and development workflow improvements without becoming a long-term team dependency.
bullets.text_short: Unblocked DevOps + refactoring + workflow improvements without long-term dependency.

items.search_blob: Vexor Network | Web3 Reputation Protocol | Senior Software Engineer (Fractional CTO / Advisor) | dates 2024-11–2025-02 | Built and hardened a React frontend + Python backend on Google Cloud for a pre-beta launch phase. | Implemented caching; reduced API response times ~40% (expected load). | Improved CI/CD; reduced deployment errors and sped up releases (~25%). | Added server-side validation + rate limiting to reduce abuse during onboarding. | tags backend caching devops enablement fullstack infra observability performance product refactoring reliability security stakeholder ux | tech python react ci/cd devops

items.org_descriptor: Web3 Digital Asset Investment & Launch Platform

role.title: Senior (Backend / Full Stack) Engineer – Financial System & Security

bullets.text_long: Safeguarded ~$4M client assets on-chain over ~3 years with zero security incidents by maintaining/improving smart contracts + backend services.
bullets.text_short: Safeguarded ~$4M on-chain assets with zero incidents via smart contracts + backend hardening.

bullets.text_long: Cut monthly cloud costs ~60% by simplifying AWS architecture, removing waste, tuning services.
bullets.text_short: Cut AWS spend ~60% by simplifying architecture and tuning services.

bullets.text_long: Reduced cost of a key on-chain operation ~99% by redesigning Ethereum workflow (batching + verification).
bullets.text_short: Reduced gas cost ~99% via batching + verification redesign.

bullets.text_long: Introduced automated testing + CI/CD to reduce manual errors and release friction.
bullets.text_short: Introduced automated tests + CI/CD to reduce release errors.

bullets.text_long: Helped product achieve 9/10 external security audit score; collaborated with auditors to address findings.
bullets.text_short: Partnered with auditors; helped reach 9/10 security audit score.

bullets.text_long: Saved ~$50K+ in outsourcing/agency spend by taking backend/infra/security in-house.
bullets.text_short: Brought backend/infra/security in-house; avoided ~$50K+ outsourcing spend.

role.title: Senior (Backend / Full Stack) Engineer – Scalability & Reliability

bullets.text_long: Scaled backend throughput ~10× to handle thousands of concurrent players without increasing hosting costs.
bullets.text_short: Scaled throughput ~10× for thousands of concurrent players without higher hosting costs.

bullets.text_long: Improved resilience so outages could be recovered in seconds vs minutes.
bullets.text_short: Improved recovery from minutes to seconds.

bullets.text_long: Built data analysis pipeline flagging ~10% of activity as likely fraudulent; partnered with product/ops to reduce abuse.
bullets.text_short: Built fraud pipeline; flagged ~10% activity; reduced abuse with product/ops.

bullets.text_long: Collaborated with mobile + product teams to prioritize performance fixes with biggest UX/reviews impact.
bullets.text_short: Prioritized performance fixes with mobile/product for best UX impact.

bullets.text_long: Improved reliability in a high-traffic SaaS from ~65% → 92%.
bullets.text_short: Improved reliability from ~65% to ~92%.

bullets.text_short: Built UI/workflows; iterated from user feedback.

bullets.text_short: Added auditability + reporting to meet regulatory expectations.

bullets.text_long: Worked closely with founder + early users to refine features; translated security requirements into usable product.
bullets.text_short: Translated security requirements into usable product with founder/early users.

bullets.text_short: Automated SecOps checks; saved ~3 hours/day; reduced error risk.

bullets.text_short: Built 3 subsystems on ASP.NET/C# + Oracle/DB2; contributed MVP→v1 in regulated banking.

bullets.text_long: Maintained systems, developed new APIs, integrated modern interfaces, and collaborated within a large team on a substantial codebase.
bullets.text_short: Maintained systems; built APIs; integrated interfaces; worked in large team codebase.

items.name: Block By Block
items.descriptor: Early-Stage Product (Stealth / Pre-Seed) — Empower Projects to Engage Community

bullets.text_long: Partnered with a former colleague to translate a raw product idea into a demo in 10 days, focusing on the smallest surface needed for investor and user validation.
bullets.text_short: Built investor demo in 10 days focusing on minimal surface for validation.

bullets.text_long: Built a mock but realistic MVP to support early demos and fundraising conversations, prioritizing speed without creating throwaway architecture.
bullets.text_short: Built realistic MVP for demos/fundraising without throwaway architecture.

bullets.text_long: Designed and implemented a cloud-native backend on GCP, integrating multiple third-party SaaS services with a structure ready to scale beyond the MVP.
bullets.text_short: Built cloud-native GCP backend integrating third-party SaaS with scale-ready structure.

bullets.text_long: Architected the system to support an initial ~4,000-user waitlist, with clear separation between MVP shortcuts and production-ready components.
bullets.text_short: Architected for ~4,000 waitlist with MVP vs production boundaries.

bullets.text_long: Balanced rapid delivery with long-term maintainability by defining clean service boundaries and deployment patterns early.
bullets.text_short: Defined service boundaries + deployment patterns early for maintainability.

items.name: Shahin

bullets.text_long: Built offline-first, CPU-only computer vision system to detect/record car traffic; avoided cloud inference.
bullets.text_short: Built offline CPU-only CV system for traffic detection without cloud inference.

bullets.text_long: Enabled fast custom reporting (“who entered when?”) for non-technical staff.
bullets.text_short: Enabled custom reporting for non-technical staff.

bullets.text_long: Worked with local stakeholders to define “useful security data” and iterate reports.
bullets.text_short: Worked with stakeholders to define useful security data and iterate reports.

items.name: dTip

bullets.text_long: Identified gap in transparent, non-custodial crypto donations; built open-source dApp as weekend project.
bullets.text_short: Built open-source dApp for transparent non-custodial donations.

bullets.text_long: Designed simple web flow so non-technical donors can send on-chain donations without deep wallet knowledge.
bullets.text_short: Designed simple donation UX for non-technical donors.

bullets.text_long: Shipped end-to-end MVP integrating smart contracts + web frontend; real-time on-chain transparency for donors/recipients.
bullets.text_short: Shipped MVP integrating contracts + web frontend with real-time on-chain visibility.

bullets.text_long: Wrote clear documentation for contributors/users to understand/extend the system.
bullets.text_short: Wrote documentation for contributors/users.

items.name: Khavar
items.description: Car-buyer configures options (glass, tires, engine, etc.) and tracks build/customization progress with verifiable integrity, reducing reliance on dealer trust.

bullets.text_long: Built an MVP solo in ~3 months: end-to-end delivery from requirements → working system.
bullets.text_short: Built MVP solo in ~3 months (requirements→working system).

bullets.text_long: Implemented verifiable progress + integrity tracking for a customization workflow using a permissioned blockchain network.
bullets.text_short: Implemented verifiable progress/integrity tracking on permissioned blockchain.

bullets.text_long: Modeled configurable manufacturing/customization events as auditable state transitions on Hyperledger Fabric.
bullets.text_short: Modeled auditable state transitions on Hyperledger Fabric.

items.search_blob: Khavar | Verifiable Car Customization Tracking (Permissioned Blockchain) | Technical Co-Founder | dates 2018-10–2019-01 | Car-buyer configures options (glass, tires, engine, etc.) and tracks build/customization progress with verifiable integrity, reducing reliance on dealer trust. | Built MVP solo in ~3 months (requirements→working system). | Implemented verifiable progress/integrity tracking on permissioned blockchain. | Modeled auditable state transitions on Hyperledger Fabric. | tags backend blockchain compliance fullstack product security stakeholder | tech hyperledger fabric

bullets.text_long: Collaborated with an academic researcher on improving MPLS routing protocol behavior.
bullets.text_short: Collaborated on improving MPLS routing behavior.

bullets.text_long: Implemented routing simulations in OMNeT++ using C++ to model protocol behavior under different conditions.
bullets.text_short: Implemented OMNeT++ C++ simulations for routing behavior.

bullets.text_long: Ran experiments and generated result datasets to support the research analysis and conclusions.
bullets.text_short: Ran experiments and produced datasets for analysis.

bullets.text_long: Translated theoretical routing concepts into executable simulation logic.
bullets.text_short: Translated theory into executable simulation logic.

bullets.text_long: Built an MVP solo in ~3 months: end-to-end delivery from requirements → working system.
bullets.text_short: Built MVP in ~3 months (requirements→working system).

bullets.text_long: Built a CV-trained chatbot constrained to answer only from my resume; tested against prompt injection and irrelevant queries to enforce strict domain boundaries.
bullets.text_short: Built resume-only chatbot; tested prompt injection; enforced strict boundaries.

bullets.text_long: Designed the system to fail closed (no hallucinated answers outside allowed context).
bullets.text_short: Designed fail-closed behavior to avoid out-of-scope answers.

bullets.text_long: Currently building an n8n-based automation to turn rough ideas into directioned research topics with minimal manual steps.
bullets.text_short: Building n8n automation to convert ideas into guided research topics.

items.name: Valory — OLAS Autonomous Agent Bootcamp
items.descriptor: Autonomous AI agents using OLAS stack

bullets.text_long: Completed a 1-month remote bootcamp on building autonomous AI agents using the OLAS stack.
bullets.text_short: Completed OLAS autonomous agent bootcamp (1 month).

bullets.text_long: Built hands-on agent workflows as part of the program: https://github.com/miladtsx/dcpay.
bullets.text_short: Built agent workflows; repo: miladtsx/dcpay.

outcomes.text_long: Built an autonomous crypto payment acceptance system for businesses, minimized blind trust on third-party payment processors by running key verification and settlement steps in-house.
outcomes.text_short: Built autonomous crypto payment acceptance with in-house verification/settlement.

outcomes.text_long: Implemented payment detection + confirmation logic and business-facing reporting/ops flow (e.g., invoices, reconciliation, alerts).
outcomes.text_short: Implemented payment detection/confirmation and ops reporting (invoices, reconciliation, alerts).

outcomes.text_long: Delivered as a 1-month freelance engagement following the Valory bootcamp; received multiple inbound freelance offers after graduation.
outcomes.text_short: Delivered as 1-month freelance; received inbound offers after graduation.

items.name: Autonomous AI Agent Development Framework – OLAS

rules.description: No empty bullets or dangling markers allowed in rendered output.
Any metric claim_type must have evidence.type != none OR confidence != high.
No duplicate text_short entries within the same experience/project.
All tags must be within controlled_vocabulary.tags.
Dates must be YYYY-MM or null.
Overlapping dates allowed only if employment_type in [freelance, fractional, advisor, founder, research].

role_classification.decision_rule: score backend and fullstack signals; if within 20% treat as mixed; otherwise pick max
tie_breakers: If JD explicitly says 'Full Stack' -> fullstack
If JD emphasizes ownership of UI/UX -> fullstack
If JD emphasizes low-latency, microservices, infra, on-call -> backend

metric_phrasing_rules.when_confidence_low: Prefer 'reduced', 'improved', 'materially' and avoid exact % unless the metric is explicitly measured.
metric_phrasing_rules.when_evidence_measured: Allowed to keep exact metric with brief method if space permits (e.g., 'measured via Google Lighthouse').

cta_templates: If useful, I can share 1-page notes on similar systems.
Can send a targeted 1-pager + relevant examples.
Happy to walk through the scaling/reliability work.

regex_rules.conditional_proof: (?i)\b(if you (can )?read this|to prove you read( this)?|if you saw this)\b

known_issues.description: Removed empty tag entry from edu_bsc.tags to satisfy tag validation gate.

notes: Keep metric claims conservative when confidence is low or evidence measurement is 'estimate'.

rules.description: Cover note must not include greetings, hype, or generic cover-letter filler; must be <= max_chars.
